title: 107_s1577
content: The Act titled "Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2001" authorizes additional projects. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include specific projects in Hidalgo County and Cameron County, Texas, as identified in engineering reports dated January and February 2001. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include water conservation projects in various irrigation districts in Texas, as identified in engineering reports dated February 2001. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include water conservation projects in various Texas irrigation districts, such as off-district pump station, canal replacement, and improvement projects identified in engineering reports by Melden & Hunt, Inc. and Gebliard-Sarma and Associates. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include water conservation projects in Texas irrigation districts, such as canal lining projects identified in engineering reports by AW Blair Engineering and Gebliard-Sarma and Associates. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include water conservation projects in Texas irrigation districts. This includes rehabilitation and improvements in the Maverick Main Canal, Hidalgo County Irrigation District No. 6, Wisconsin Canal, and Lateral 'A' Canal as identified in engineering reports by AW Blair Engineering, Sigler, Winston, Greenwood and Associates, Inc., and Gebliard-Sarma and Associates. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include water conservation projects in Texas irrigation districts, such as rehabilitation and improvements in various canals as identified in engineering reports. Additional amendments are made. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to establish a program for water conservation projects under cooperative agreements. The Secretary will review and evaluate project proposals based on specific guidelines. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to establish a program for water conservation projects under cooperative agreements. Project sponsors may choose to enter into contracts with the Secretary for report preparation, including operation, maintenance, repair, and replacement. The Federal share of the cost of report preparation by the Secretary is determined. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to adjust the total project cost and expenditure limits for report preparation by the Secretary. The construction authorization is increased to $47,000,000 to reflect changes in costs. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to increase construction authorization to $47,000,000, adjusted for changes in costs based on the Consumer Price Index.
